vocabURI="http://lod.data-archive.ac.uk/skoshasset/27ff1e6a-bb05-45e8-bcc9-4b42f5d4d381">WORKERS PARTICIPATION</keyword>         <topcClas>Election and campaign studies - Politics</topcClas>       </subject>       <abstract><p>Abstract copyright UK Data Service and data collection copyright owner.</p>To study the development of public opinion during the year prior to the General Election and in the campaign itself, by using new techniques for high speed surveys.</abstract>       <abstract><B>Main Topics</B>:<br> Variables<br> A wide range of political perceptions and attitudes; voting.</abstract>       <sumDscr>         <collDate event="start" date="1983-01-01T00:00:00Z">1983</collDate>         <collDate event="end" date="1987-01-01T00:00:00Z">1987</collDate>         <nation>Great Britain</nation>         <geogUnit>Standard Statistical Regions</geogUnit>         <anlyUnit>Individuals</anlyUnit>         <universe>National</universe>         <universe>Electors</universe>         <universe>Electors in Great Britain, 1983-1987</universe>       </sumDscr>     </stdyInfo>     <method>       <dataColl>         <timeMeth>Longitudinal/panel/cohort</timeMeth>         <timeMeth>5 waves</timeMeth>         <sampProc>This survey is a panel survey based upon three sources: the British Election Study, 1983 (SN:2005), the British Social Attitudes Survey, 1986 (SN:2315) and <i>Clones</i> (substitutes for individuals leaving the panel).  Interlocking quota target weights taking account of Class, Age, Sex and Region (<i>CASR</i>) are applied, modifying the original weights, in order to make any analytic dataset conform to the same characteristics as the 1986 British Social Attitudes Survey.</sampProc>         <deviat>7393 (obtained)   respondents in (5 waves)</deviat>         <collMode>Face-to-face interview; Telephone interview</collMode>         <sources />         <weight>No information recorded</weight>       </dataColl>     </method>     <dataAccs>       <setAvail>         <accsPlac>UK Data Service</accsPlac>       </setAvail>       <useStmt>         <specPerm>Standard conditions of access</specPerm>         <restrctn>The depositor has specified that registration is required and standard conditions of use apply. The depositor may be informed about usage. See <a href=http://ukdataservice.ac.uk/get-data/how-to-access/conditions.aspx>terms and conditions of access</a> for further information.</restrctn>         <contact><a href=http://www.ukdataservice.ac.uk/help/get-in-touch.aspx>Get in touch</a></contact>       </useStmt>     </dataAccs>     <othrStdyMat>       <relStdy>2005 British General Election Study, 1983; Cross-Section Survey </relStdy>       <relStdy>2315 British Social Attitudes Survey, 1986 </relStdy>       <relPubl>Miller, W.L., <i>How voters change : the 1987 British Election Campaign in perspective</i> (Oxford: Oxford University Press, 1990)<br></relPubl>       <relPubl>   </relPubl>       <othRefs>Language Of Study Description: English</othRefs>     </othrStdyMat>   </stdyDscr> </codeBook>
